data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: A destroyed Rock ship drifts, its hull picked clean recently. However, you are lucky and find one surviving crate of ammunition.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A team of Lost Sun ships appear to be demolishing a nearby Crystalline shrine. They hail you, asking if you can spare any explosives.
Lend them some missiles.

"We were not expecting a supply ship any time soon, and this may help." They fire a rocket directly into the foundation of the structure, sending the entire thing crumbling. "Surprising. We have not had access to quality ammunitions such as these in a long time. May we keep the spares?"
Let them keep the missiles.
"Your good will has been noted. Let us repay you, captain."
Request that they give the spares back.
"Fine, but do not think that we will forget this. You may think these come in easy supply, but they do not."
Apologize and turn down their offer.
The Lost Suns do not try to hail you again. You put some distance between yourself and them just in case.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
An incessant beeping on your radar shows a strange object floating in empty space. It appears to be... a Lost Sun weapon cache?
Open it.
Don't risk it.
Stealing military supplies in Lost Sun territory doesn't sound like a good idea. You leave it be.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/eventList[@: You pry open the cache to find racks and racks of ammunition.
The cache is filled mostly with first aid supplies and rations. You do however find a fire weapon, the black sheep of the supplies.
The cache is harder to open than you expected. You spend some time trying to open it when a Lost Sun ship spots you, and attacks! You abandon the cache and prepare to fight.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: A Lost Sun fleet appears to be protecting the nearby moon, which houses a relatively large mining operation. On closer inspection, it seems the fleet is poorly armed.
Contact them.

"A Federation ship, in our sector? Are you another supply runner?" You shake your head. "Hmph. I do not normally request help from strangers who may or may not be welcome, but we are in need of ammunition. Do you have any warheads that you can spare?"
Give them some missiles.
"I see you are not sparing with your supplies. All the same, it was not my place to ask. Something is better than nothing..."
Continue...
Reluctantly, the Lost Sun captain gives you some scrap as payment.
Give them many missiles.
"This is quite the supply. You surprise me, Federation captain. I suppose I am now in your debt."
Continue...
Thankful for your large donation, the Lost Suns pay you back with ample scrap.
(Recycler) Give them the augment.
"Interesting technology. I have heard of it, yes, but our budget is low. This will help us considerably. Thank you, captain."
Continue...
The Lost Suns repay your tech with some of their own, as well as some scrap.
We cannot help.
"As expected. Hurry along then, and hope misfortune does not follow you."
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Leave them.
There isn't anything that concerns you here. You fly away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Continue...
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: "This is our territory, Federation. Not all of us welcome your pity. Get out of our sector, or we will send you to the fiery pits of the underworld."
You find yourself in an argument with another Lost Sun ship over restricted beacons and such, and soon their weapons are drawn!
Not all Lost Suns are appreciative of the Federation's help, and some are even angered by it. The one at this beacon most certainly does not appreciate your presence.
Your presence appears to have offended the Lost Sun ship at this beacon in some way, because their weapons are ready and aimed straight at you!
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: Continue...
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: "Your alliance with the radical terrorist group that is the Lost Suns will not be tolerated anymore, Federation Captain."
The Rock government frequently sends ships to attack this sector. One such ship has noticed you, and doesn't risk you revealing their position.
Shots scatter across your defenses, but none do any severe damage. An unseen Rock ship scouting out the sector is attacking!
"Brave, coming here. The Rockmen do not appreciate your support of these arsonists, and we intend to do right by our true leaders!"
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: Continue...
Continue...
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: As the Rockmen are a powerful ally of the Coalition, they have requested that some force be dispatched to take care of the Lost Sun threat. The ship here appears to group you in with that threat and attacks!
A Coalition ship hunting down Lost Sun ships spots you. They waste no time to power up their weapons and attack.
An angered Slug captain aboard the Coalition ship at this beacon hails you. "I came here to hunt ssome fire-obsssesssed freaksss, not more Federation asssssholesss! Prepare to be erasssed."
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: Attack the Rock.
You lock weapons with the Rock ship, eager to prove your loyalty to the Lost Suns. The Lost Sun ship shows no cowardice, providing support from the background.
Continue...
Attack the Lost Sun.

You suppose it doesn't hurt to win the Rock's favor. Assuming you destroy the Lost Sun ship, no one will hear about your betrayal. Suprisingly, the Rock continues to provide fire support against the Lost Sun ship.
Continue...
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: A Rock and Lost Sun ship are dueling at this beacon. Both notice you, and surprisingly both also call for your aid.
Taking sides in a duel can be a dangerous way to prove loyalty. At this beacon, a Rock and Lost Sun ship are fighting. Both have clearly noticed you, so you're going to have to save one of them.
Both the Rock and Lost Sun ship at this beacon are aware of your presence, but are too busy fighting to deal with you. Whose side will you take?

You find yourself faced with a dilemma as a Rock and Lost Sun ship are locked in a dogfight at this beacon. Either way, you can't leave without angering both, so you're going to have to make a choice.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: "You surprise me, Federation Captain. Perhaps you really do have our best interest in mind." They pay you in thanks.
"Interesting. This was not the expected result. You Federation really are the treacherous scum we have been told. Still, we are in your debt, and we intend to pay it off."
You hear the unmistakable sound of the explosion of a fire bomb and a teleporter's whirl. You aren't sure where they came from, but you have some unwelcome visitors for sure!
The Lost Suns have little fear of solar flares. The captain of the ship at this beacon chuckles. "Afraid of a little fire, captain? Let us duel, TO THE DEATH!"
Continue...

This asteroid field appears to be housing a Rock spy trying to hide from the Lost Sun patrols as it collects information. They obviously aren't interested in letting you escape with their information, and attack!
Continue...
Scans reveal a large asteroid field nearby. Short-range scanners may discover useful materials while we wait for the FTL to recharge.
Explore the asteroid field.
Too dangerous. We'll just wait for the FTL to charge.
You decide to ignore the asteroids.
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
(Scrap Recovery Arm) Attempt to mine the asteroids.
You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
(Mining Equipment) Attempt to mine the asteroids.
You carefully extract as much usable material as possible from the nearest asteroids while waiting for the FTL to charge.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/eventList[@: A brief exploration yields nothing of interest.
Scans reveal a number of asteroids with useful compositions. You extract some fuel.
You discover the remains of ship embedded into an asteroid. It still has some functional missiles.
You happen upon an abandoned mining site. A few mining drones were left behind and could be repurposed.
The asteroid field proved more dangerous than expected. Some asteroids managed to get through your ship's defenses.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: You see a Lost Sun ship attacking an unarmed civilian ship trying to pass through the sector. You doubt the Lost Sun notices you, due to its complete focus on mauling civilians.
Protect the civilians.
You kick your engines into high gear and chase away the Lost Sun from the civilian. Time for a fight.
Continue...
Ignore the ships.
The civilians continue trying to hail you. You tune them out and fly away until you're completely alone.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

A Lost Sun ship protecting this beacon promptly hails you a little while after jumping in nearby. "A passing ship! We have a challenge for you. Best us in combat, and we shall give you a reward. Accept a greater challenge, and we shall give an even greater reward!"
Fight them for a normal reward.
"Let the battle commence!"
Continue...
Fight them without life support or medical systems.
"Let the battle commence!"
Continue...
Fight them with a weakened reactor.
"Let the battle commence!"
Continue...
Fight them with weakened systems.
"Let the battle commence!"
Continue...
Fight them with severely weakened systems.
"Let the battle commence!"
Continue...
We aren't looking for a fight.
"I did not take you for cowards. Oh well, perhaps it is for the best."
Check the storage.
Do nothing.
A Lost Sun confinement appears to be keeping several ships from various origins captive. A patrol ship is searching the area, and you won't have long until it sees you.
Attack the barricade and free the civilians.
Your attacks are inefficient, and several countershots get through your defenses. You get out of their range in time but the patrol ship moves in to attack!
Attack the patrol ship.
You know you're taking a risk, but you could use the extra scrap. You power up your weapons and engage the patrol ship.
Ignore the ships.
You manage to escape the patrol ship. You should still leave the beacon as soon as possible.
(Cloaking) Wait for the patrol ship to pass by, then sabotage their defenses.

Your waiting pays off when the patrol ship passes right by, and eventually passes out of your view. You sneak up to the confinement and lay down the explosives, then fly to a safe distance to watch the fireworks.
Continue...

Chaos erupts in the Lost Sun structure as explosions ripple across the surface. One appears to have disabled the main power to the shield keeping the civilians at bay, and they escape. The civilians spot you and, putting two and two together, decide to pay you for freeing them.
A Rock spy appears to be hiding in this asteroid field. You don't see them for very long until they've already slipped out of sight.
Pursue them.
Ignore the spy.
There's no reason to be chasing down random Rock ships in asteroid fields. You prepare to leave as quickly as possible.
(Upg. Engines) Use your improved engines to track them down.
You manage to catch up to the Rock spy. They don't take kindly to you following them, and attack.
Continue...
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/eventList[@: You manage to catch up to the Rock spy. They don't take kindly to you following them, and attack.
You are unable to track down the Rock ship, leaving you lost in the asteroids.

You successfully manage to track down the Rock ship, but not fast enough. A large asteroid crashes into their hull, tearing the ship apart. You try to scrap what you can without suffering the same fate.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: The red ship at this beacon belongs to the Mantis. With no obvious motives, you aren't sure why they came here.
Attack the Mantis.
Theres no words that need be exchanged. As soon as you begin to approach it is clear that your intentions are hostile, and the Mantis prepare to defend themselves.
Continue...
Hail them.

The Mantis appear mildly shocked that you reached out to them. Before they can speak however, a Lost Sun ship comes flying out of nowhere and blasts the Mantis ship into oblivion. They seem to identify you as a threat as well.
Continue...
Leave.
Contrary to expectations, the Mantis make no attempt to follow. You distance yourself from their ship.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/eventList[@: Most of the wreckage is too charred to be salvaged, but you still scrap what you can.

Upon investigation, the bridge of the ship fared slightly better than the rest of the ship. A lone Mantis survivor lays trembling in the corner, and almost kills one of your crew as you approach. However after some coaxing you convince him to join your crew.

The weaponry that destroyed this ship has left only worthless junk. As you are about to give up, your eye catches a small crate drifting near what was once the cargo-bay. It contains a few fuel cells that managed to survive the explosion.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: A Lost Sun ship at this beacon has already spotted you before it's too late to slip away unnoticed. They hail you.
Answer the call.

"So, you are the Federation ship that we have heard so much about, intruding on our sector in some dangerous quest to destroy the Flagship? Brave, and stupid. Stupid that you think you have the right to endanger our sector by drawing the fleet here. If you wish to pass unharmed, you must answer some questions and prove you are worthy."
Agree.
"We Lost Suns have been fighting a war against the brutal Rock dictatorship for years. For which crime do we hold them responsible and sparked the start of this bloody war?"
The use of propaganda to lie to their citizens.
Founding the Coalition.
"The Coalition is not our enemy, only the Rock Elders and their lies! Not every enemy of the Federation is an enemy of the rest of the galaxy. Let us teach you a well-deserved lesson."
Continue...
Being a bunch of assholes.
"That is not even a crime! If you cannot even be mature, then it is clear you do not belong here. Prepare to have your life extinguished."
Continue...
(Lost Sun Commando) The use of propaganda to lie to their citizens.
Refuse.
"Expected. Then your untimely death is your fault, and your fault alone."
"Very good, though that was a question anyone but the Rock people themselves could answer."
Continue...
"We Lost Suns are devoted to our religion. Which race is the strongest and most pure of any other?"
The Rockmen.

"You are incorrect. You think pandering to us will get you anywhere? No race is pure, until they are engulfed in the holy fire! You are not worthy of such treatment. Prepare to be destroyed by filthy mortal flames."
The Crystals.

"Bah haha! That is the lie told to us from birth! The Crystals are no gods, they are false idols! Clearly, you too believe the lies of the Elders. We will remove you from this world in which you do not belong."
None. Only the holy fires can truly be pure.
The Federation.
The Lost Sun captain decends into clear rage. "You think this is funny? The Federation is not even a race! I have no time for this idiocy. I will cleanse your sins with fire!"
(Lost Sun Commando) None. Only the holy fires can truly be pure.
"Yes, the fires that gave birth to all life are the only thing that can cleanse us of our sins!"
Continue...
"No government is free of lies or scandals. Prove to us that you see through the lies that your precious Federation has been spreading for years."
The Federation has been supporting the Lost Suns only to cripple the Coalition.
The Federation is as responsible for the Rebellion as the Rebels themselves.
The Federation has committed as many warcrimes as any of their enemies.
The Federation has never told a lie.
"Hah! So you are truly a simple minded fool, following what you are told blindly. There is no room for people like you in this galaxy."
(Lost Sun Commando) Your commando does not know the answer.

Despite the question not involving the commando, you still turn to them for an answer. They shrug. The Lost Sun captain grows tired of waiting. "This is a simple question captain! I have no more time for your nonsense."

"You impress me, captain. I have challenged many, many ships who have passed through here before, and not one has been able to prove themselves. You have my respect. Let me come with you on your journey, so that I may see how a surveyor of truth such as yourself handles such a daunting mission that awaits you."

An entire Rock settlement, a remnant from before the Lost Sun's takeover of this sector, is rooted on the nearby planetoid. However that record doesn't seem like it will last long, as a Lost Sun ship is assaulting the settlement's poorly maintained defences.
Help the Rockmen and destroy the Lost Suns.
Not all Rockmen should be blamed for the antagony of their government. You block the Lost Suns and prepare to fight.
Continue...
Aid in the destruction of the settlement.

You approach to attack the settlement but the Lost Sun ship stops you. "Federation, this is not a job for you. Leave this beacon so that we may carry out our duty." You fly a safe distance away before they can reinforce their words with weapons.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Ignore the settlement.
You try not to think of all the innocent lives that will be lost because of this attack, and try to focus on doing something aboard the ship instead.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/eventList[@: The Rockmen are grateful for your help. They were a small farming colony that was cut off from the main trade routes after the Lost Suns captured the sector and were stuck in poverty. A few good-natured Federation ships in the past had given them some supplies, but this inevitably led to their discovery. They have nothing to pay you, so instead they fix up your hull.

The colony did not fare as well as you had expected. Most of the Lost Sun's attacks had made their way past the weak shield protecting the structures on the surface, killing a good portion of their population. They have nothing that they can spare you other than a feeble thank you, but one of the survivors offers to join your crew, as his life in the settlement no longer holds any promise.
data/events_lostsun.xml$/FTL/event[@name: A poorly armed civilian ship is stuck at this beacon, evidently out of fuel. They beg you to spare them some capsules so that they can escape the sector before a Lost Sun patrol find them.
Lend some fuel.
The civilians are grateful for your help.
Continue...
They don't have much scrap to spare, but decide to lend some extra missiles and perform repairs to your hull.
Tell them that you cannot help.
In a fit of pure desperation and as a last ditch attempt to save their lives, the civilians power on their weapons and attack you.
Continue...

You arrive to the location of the distress beacon, but the ship that was once here has been reduced to a singed wreck. It is impossible to discern what faction is used to belong to. You don't know what happened to their attacker, but you figure it's safe to salvage.

A Coalition ship, sent to sabotage the Lost Suns, appears to have already arrived at the location of the distress beacon. Whoever was the original source of the distress is long gone, but the Coalition doesn't intend on letting you go easily.
Continue...
A gathering of Lost Sun ships is nearby. They're suspicious of your presence and begin to distance themselves from your ship.
Hail them.

The Lost Suns are reluctant to respond until you show your Federation badge, which luckily seems to resonate with them. "So, eager to prove your alliance? We have a task for you, but it is of utmost importance. Are you up for a challenge?"
Agree.

"At the following co-ordinates you will find a Rock comms station set up here to relay information on our revolution to the Rock Elders. We're planning an invasion on the nearby planet which also hosts a Rock settlement, but we cannot do so until the comms station is destroyed. We request that you disable it in any way you can so we can go forward with our attack."
We cannot risk our primary mission.
"Then you already know too much." The other ships disperse while the largest of the group moves in to attack.
We should do the same.
Once they see you too avoiding their group, the Lost Suns relax and continue their secretive discussion.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You've found the Rock comms station the Lost Suns told you about. It's very poorly armed, though you can't stage a full scale attack without the settlement dispatching reinforcements.
Attempt to fire on the station from a distance.

Your feeble attacks are ineffective on the station, and a settlement ship is sent to chase you off. Your hull takes some damage but after you've put a good distance between yourself and the settlement the ship stops chasing you.
(Hacking) Shut down the station's systems.
Your hacking is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
Continue...
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.
(Slug Crew) Have your Slug hack into their relay systems.
Your Slug is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
Continue...
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.
(Engi Crew) Have your Engi hack into their relay systems.
Your Engi is able to temporarily shut down the sensor station long enough to damage their relay systems. You hail the Lost Suns, who jump in shortly after and quickly take over the settlement.
Continue...
The head Lost Sun ship thanks you for your help, and pays you.
There's nothing we can do.
It's too risky to attack the station. You hope the Lost Suns find a different way to complete their mission.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

Arriving at the beacon, you find there is already a ship here, a very poorly armed Lost Sun. They hail you. "Good, at last someone came. Our distress beacon malfunctioned and we were not sure someone "friendly" would arrive in time. Our ship ran out of ammunitions, and we had to switch to some weaker weapons. Unfortunately, this also means we cannot protect ourselves from the Rock and Coalition hunters. We request that you escort us to the nearest outpost."
Agree to escort them.
"Your eagerness to assist us has been noted. We will follow you to these co-ordinates."
Deny their request.
"So, the things I have heard about the Federation are true? I should've expected this. Go, leave this place and hope you do not fall victim to the same enemies that we are defenseless against."
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Offer some ammo.
"No, we do not need your donations or gifts. We only request an escort."
Agree to escort them.
"Your eagerness to assist us has been noted. We will follow you to these co-ordinates."
Deny their request.
"So, the things I have heard about the Federation are true? I should've expected this. Go, leave this place and hope you do not fall victim to the same enemies that we are defenseless against."
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You arrive at the outpost, but it is too late. A large elite Rock ship has already demolished the structure. They spot you and hardly give you a chance to assess the situation before attacking.
Continue...
You salvage the ship. Much of the wreckage can be recovered as scrap. You offer to share the spoils with the Lost Suns, but they refuse. You salvage what you can carry before contacting them further.
Continue...

"So, our outpost has been... destroyed. This was unexpected. Your aid is much appreciated Federation Captain, but I must ask one more favor of you. I have tried to be devoted to the Lost Sun cause, but after this tragedy... the loss of many of my friends... I see now this war of ours will lead to nothing but bloodshed. I have nothing left. May I come with you, to experience all that I would never see if I stayed here, fighting a pointless war?"
Accept.
The Rockman eagerly hurries to gather his things and come aboard. He says a brief, formal farewell to his crew, wishing them luck in their future struggles.
Sorry, but we don't need more crew.

The Rockman looks upset, but he quickly goes back to his usual formal manner. "I suppose this makes sense. You too are fighting a war as well. As promised, payment is due, even if the outcome of this mission has been a failure."
A Lost Sun vessel is nearby, their captain frantically pacing back and forth. "You there- you belong to the Federation fleet? You must assist us. It is of the highest importance."
Listen to their request.

"Our leader, Admiral Ariadne's personal cruiser has been taken by Inquisition forces at these co-ordinates. You must rescue her under any conditions, or else we are doomed. The Federation is the Lost Suns' only ally, we must rely solely on your efforts for our continued survival."
We don't have the time.
The Rockman merely grunts and flies away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

The fleet the Lost Suns mentioned isn't present at the co-ordinates they gave, but the cruiser is! The ship hails you, a gruff Rockman with a scar down his eye staring you down. "The Inquisition has recovered this vessel, and the same shall be for this entire sector. It would be wise for the Federation to cut ties with the Lost Suns and leave at once, or face the wrath of a second Inquisition. It is only a matter of time until the Theocracy rises again; which side do you want to be on?"
You're right, the Lost Suns are a pathetic ally to the Theocracy's strength.
"So you have changed your mind so suddenly? What makes you say these words?"
The Lost Suns are rash and violent. The Theocracy knows how to time its strikes.

The Rockman on the camera changes his composure. "You know nothing then. Too easily persuaded, an unworthy ally to the Lost Suns. Be glad you get off easy, I would much rather squish your head had I orders not to."
The Inquisition has failed before.
"THE INQUISITION HAS NEVER FAILED! We have merely... paused our efforts, until the time is right. The Coalition shall be the spark that reignites the fires of fury in our hearts."
Spoken like a true Lost Sun.
"You dare insult the might and grace of the Elder's holy crusades? You die here!"
Continue...
This isn't a hill to die on. Leave.
Remain silent and leave.

"Yes, and it is safe to say you have passed. The Lost Suns are not sparing with their alliances. If you truly represent the Federation, then you have done a good job showing your loyalty. The Theocracy will resent ever having crossed our path with you on our side."
Continue...

"It would be criminal to not extend aid to you as well. I will provide you with quality military supplies to assist you. I have already begun the transfer of the blueprints for this very ship to the Federation, in hopes it will be used in their fight."
As a matter of fact, I did overthrow the Rock government once.

Ariadne breaks into laughter, but stops. "My stars, you ARE the ship we heard about. Overthrow is hardly the word, but you have sent their homeworlds into chaos! Your efforts have been a considerable aid to ours. Allow me to help you in every way I can."
